com.ibm.jaggr.core.resource

Class AbstractResourceBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.jaggr.core.resource.AbstractResourceBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IResource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractHttpTransport.LoaderExtensionResource, AggregationResource, ExceptionResource, FileResource, NotFoundResource, StringResource

    public abstract class AbstractResourceBase
extends Object
implements IResource
    Base class implementation for IResource. Provide functionality common to most implementations.

    • Method Detail

      • getURI

        public URI getURI()
        Description copied from interface: IResource
        Returns the URI for this resource. Note that there is no requirement that the value returned be the same value that was provided to the IResourceFactory object used to create this instance. Neither is there any requirement that the path/filename of the URI have any relationship to the URI originally specified in IAggregator.newResource(URI). The method may return a URI to a file in a cache directory with an arbitrary name as a result of bundle extraction and/or running resource converters. The file extension portion of the URI will be the same as the originally requested URI, however.

        Use IResource.getReferenceURI() to obtain the originally requested URI.

        Because instances of this object can refer to cache resources, you should not hold on to references to IResource objects long term (more than the duration of a request).

        Specified by:
        getURI in interface IResource
        Returns:
        The resource URI

      • getPath

        public String getPath()
        Description copied from interface: IResource
        Returns the reference path of this resource. This is equivalent to calling getReferenceURI().getPath().
        Specified by:
        getPath in interface IResource
        Returns:
        the reference path of the resource

      • getReferenceURI

        public URI getReferenceURI()
        Description copied from interface: IResource
        Returns the reference URI. This is the URI that was passed to IAggregator.newResource(URI), before any conversions by resource factories or resource converters. This URI may or may not be the same value that is returned by IResource.getURI() and it may be a pseudo URI specifying a scheme that is not directly supported by the platform (e.g. namedbundleresource).
        Specified by:
        getReferenceURI in interface IResource
        Returns:
        the reference URI.

      • setReferenceURI

        public void setReferenceURI(URI uri)
        Description copied from interface: IResource
        Sets the reference URI. This method may be called only once. If the reference URI has been set and this method is called again an IllegalStateException is thrown.
        Specified by:
        setReferenceURI in interface IResource
        Parameters:
        uri - the reference uri throws IllegalStateException

      • getSize

        public long getSize()
             throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: IResource
        Returns the size of the content for this resource. Note that not all implementations are able to support this method. If the size cannot be provided, a IOException is thrown.
        Specified by:
        getSize in interface IResource
        Returns:
        the size of the content for the resource

      • walkTree

        public void walkTree(IResourceVisitor visitor)
              throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: IResource
        Walks the folder tree rooted at the current resource, calling the IResourceVisitor.visitResource(IResourceVisitor.Resource, String) method for each resource or folder resource encountered.

        If this resource is not a folder, then visitor's IResourceVisitor.visitResource(IResourceVisitor.Resource, String) method is called once for this resource.

        Specified by:
        walkTree in interface IResource
        Parameters:
        visitor - An instance of IResourceVisitor
        Throws:
        IOException

      • asVisitorResource

        public IResourceVisitor.Resource asVisitorResource()
        Description copied from interface: IResource
        This is a convenience method to return the current resource as a IResourceVisitor.Resource object. This is useful for when you want to invoke a resource visitor for a resource that was obtained by means other than IResource.walkTree(IResourceVisitor). The resource must exist.

        Note that calling IResourceVisitor.Resource.newResource(IAggregator) on objects returned from this method will generally throw UnsupportedOperationException

        Specified by:
        asVisitorResource in interface IResource
        Returns:
        An IResourceVisitor.Resource for current resource
